robin e johnston 2025 3 heritage surprise instructions cuff you will be making a folded cuff with a picot edge by first casting on provisionally i used a crochet hook and the chained cast on see video link in page above the instructions that follow are written as if you used this technique with a scrap piece of yarn in a highly contrasting colour provisionally cast on 56 64 72 sts break scrap yarn leaving a 4-in/10cm tail and tie two knots to indicate the end from which you undo the chain change to your sock yarn and knit one row on your gauge-sized needles join the stitches in the round making sure you do not twist your work and place bor marker divide your stitches evenly with the first 28 32 36 sts as your leg front and the last 28 32 36 sts as the leg back knit 15 rounds next round is picot edge k2tog yo to the end of the round knit 15rounds you will now pick up the right leg of each of the knit stitches from the crochet chain and with wrong sides together you will knit your live stitches with the ones picked up from the crochet chain in other words you will knit two stitches together one live stitch with one provisional stitch please note it is easier to deal with the provisional stitches if you use a smaller needle to pick them up from the crochet chain and if you pick them up in batches to knit them together say half your stitches at a time undo crochet chain from the end with two knots if you have enough gauge-size needles you can make another cuff while you wait for clue two j this is the end of clue one copyright robin e johnston 2025 4 heritage surprise leg you have completed the folded cuff in clue one and your bor marks the start of the front of the leg knit one round then move to the leg chart for your size they can be found on pages 6 7 8 the leg chart only shows half of the leg stitches and so will be worked twice in
